intro: Houstonia longiflora, commonly known as the Carolina bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in acidic soil conditions. It produces small, elliptical leaves and has a low-growing, mat-forming habit. Houstonia longiflora is an important component of native plant communities and is often found in the understory of deciduous forests.
